result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher William Richardson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges by 10-04-2016.  Any cash bail posted on this case to be applied to monies owed.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
*Provide a DNA sample (if not already done so).
Consecutive to: To any sentence with credit for Zero days served; Huber privileges for employment.  Sentence to commence no later than 5:00 p.m. on April 11, 2016.
*Court advises the defendant he cannot possess firearms and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher William Richardson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Petition and Order for Funeral Pass, signed and filed.
Bail refund
4/12/16 bail refund notice/affidavit mailed to surety.

Court found the State has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant.

Court sentenced defendant to serve 11 months in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for Zero days served; Huber privileges for employment.  Sentence to commence no later than 5:00 p.m. on April 11, 2016.   
-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges by 10-04-2016.  Any cash bail posted on this case to be applied to monies owed.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-  Provide a DNA sample (if not already done so)

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
submitted by defense counsel as to sentencing.

Defendant Christopher William Richardson in court with Attorney Nicole Williams Buttery.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has five cases before the court.

Defendant advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties; waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of  GUILTY   and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and orders a judgment of conviction be entered.

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  Defendant was further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. 

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.

15RM010684  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
02/24/2015

Defendant Christopher William Richardson in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Defendant Christopher William Richardson in custody.  Ron Dague for Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No driving without a valid license. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Christopher William Richardson in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Defendant Christopher William Richardson in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
